pages.text: This chapter focuses on most of the simpler materials you'll find yourself needing sooner rather than later.

pages.title: Fiber String
pages.text: String made from Plant Fibers.

pages.title: Spool of Fiber String
pages.text: Perfect for storing string or for making clothing.

pages.title: Fiber Canvas
pages.text: Makes decent clothing and even book covers or item frames.

pages.title: Rope
pages.text: Great for climbing, but I prefer a free-standing ladder any day.

pages.title: Dried Plant Fiber
pages.text: Primarily used to create Daub or Thatch.

pages.title: Spool of String
pages.text: This string is much less abrasive on the skin.

pages.title: Cloth
pages.text: Can be made into a variety of soft items such as clothing.

pages.title: Wool
pages.text: Useful for Beds or Carpet.

pages.title: Planks
pages.text: Useful for just about everything.

pages.title: Sticks
pages.text: Likewise just as useful as its larger counterpart.

pages.title: Daub
pages.text: Decent for building structures out of Wattle and Daub, or for sealing Rain Collector Barrels.

pages.title: Tool Handle
pages.text: The key to any tool or weapon is a decent handle.

pages.title: Sturdy Tool Handle
pages.text: For a great tool or weapon, a proper handle is needed.

pages.title: Specialized Tool Handle
pages.text: Some tools such as Rock Picks require specialized handles.

pages.title: Gunpowder
pages.text: Useful for TNT or throwable potions which explode on impact.

pages.title: Bow String
pages.text: The sticky stuff used on the string gives it the strength it needs for sending arrows flying.

pages.title: Trigger Mechanism
pages.text: Used primarily for Crossbows.

pages.title: Treated Leather
pages.text: Good for sturdier leather clothes and components like straps.

pages.title: Leather Strap
pages.text: Used to make a plethora of items such as some armor types and saddles.

pages.title: Bowls
pages.text: Great for cooking up soups.

pages.title: Glass Bottle
pages.text: Can hold a variety of liquids.

pages.title: Brine
pages.text: Don't drink this unless you want to be nauseous for what feels like eternity.

pages.title: Salt
pages.text: Can't find any Salt for cooking? Just leach it out of Kelp from Sea Water!

pages.title: Quill
pages.text: Long to write a book too? This beats using charcoal on a sign any day.

pages.title: Ink Bottle
pages.text: Don't forget the ink!

pages.title: Book
pages.text: And of course, the book.

pages.title: Book and Quill
pages.text: Who knows, maybe you'll write an even better guide than this, haha!
